pattern.name: There is an Elf in my Chimney
pattern.gauge_description: 22 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch on larger needles
pattern.notes_html:
Who doesn’t love a surprise? Inspired by the naughty elves that have become so popular at Christmas, I wanted to design a sweater with a little surprise. Imagine your little persons face when they reach inside the pocket and find this mischievous little Elf?

Elf approx. 25cm tall

Sized to fit chest: 53 (56:61:65.5: 69: 73.5) cm 20.75 (22: 24: 25.75: 27.25: 29) in

CHECK OUT THE VIDEOS HERE

Needles:
Circulars 3.25mm (40cm) & 4mm (60cm)
DPN’s 3.25mm (optional for start of neck and small circumference parts)

Also needed:
Darning needle
Stitch markers
Scrap yarn or stitch holders
Toy stuffing
Two small white buttons
Cream felt
Gold embroider thread
Red pencil

Tension:
Yarn used knits as DK to this tension:
22 sts and 30 rows to measure 10 x 10cm (4 x 4in) over st st using 4mm needles.
To save time, take time to check gauge.

Pattern Notes:
This raglan sweater is worked from the top down, seamless in the round.
If giving the Elf to small child make sure you securely sew on all small pieces and embroider on buttons, rather than use buttons.
pattern.notes:
*Who doesn’t love a surprise? Inspired by the naughty elves that have become so popular at Christmas, I wanted to design a sweater with a little surprise. Imagine your little persons face when they reach inside the pocket and find this mischievous little Elf?*

Elf approx. 25cm tall

**Sized to fit chest:** 53 (56:61:65.5: 69: 73.5) cm 20.75 (22: 24: 25.75: 27.25: 29) in

[CHECK OUT THE VIDEOS HERE][1]

**Needles:**
Circulars 3.25mm (40cm) & 4mm (60cm)
DPN’s 3.25mm (optional for start of neck and small circumference parts)

**Also needed:**
Darning needle
Stitch markers
Scrap yarn or stitch holders
Toy stuffing
Two small white buttons
Cream felt
Gold embroider thread
Red pencil

**Tension:**
Yarn used knits as DK to this tension:
22 sts and 30 rows to measure 10 x 10cm (4 x 4in) over st st using 4mm needles.
To save time, take time to check gauge.

**Pattern Notes:**
This raglan sweater is worked from the top down, seamless in the round.
If giving the Elf to small child make sure you securely sew on all small pieces and embroider on buttons, rather than use buttons.


  [1]: https://shop.janeburns.co.uk/collections/christmas-jumpers/products/there-is-an-elf-in-my-chimney-sweater

pattern_author.name: Jane Burns
pattern_author.notes:
Hello. I’m Jane.

I am a knit and crochet based in Lincoln, UK. Designing projects that as are as much fun to make, as they are to wear is my focus.

Looking for whimsical knitting patterns for babies and children, please check out my catalogue.

With over 15 years experience of writing knitting patterns for the UK knitting magazines, I pride myself on well written easy to follow instructions.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Simply Knitting, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. I’ve also produced mini collections for Scheepjes, King Cole and Eden Cottage Yarns. 

I think I have one of the best jobs in the world. It has enabled me to meet lots of very talented crafters. Work with some fantastic yarn companies and even appear on live TV. That was one of the most exhilarating experiences of my life. Who knows, maybe one day I will get to do it again.

When I’m not designing you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or enjoying live music (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) 

I share my life with my husband, Doug,  my three, now not so little children and my mini schnauzer Bertie.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to [download your free gift  here][1].

***You can buy my patterns from my [Ravelry store, here][2]***

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.



  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns

users.about_me:
Hi, I’m Jane, the designer behind Jane Burns Designs. I’m a knit and crochet pattern designer based in Lincoln, UK. I love creating whimsical and fun projects that are as enjoyable to make as they are to wear.

I have been designing knitting and crochet patterns for over 15 years, and I have worked with many UK knitting magazines, such as The Knitter, Simply Knitting, Knit Now, and Let’s Knit. Collaborated with some amazing yarn companies, Scheepjes, King Cole, and Eden Cottage Yarns to name a few.

I often say that two designers share a studio in my head, one loves whimsy, bright palettes and fun elements, most seen in my children’s designs. The other, likes to focus on the bringing some calm and self-care, utilising more muted tones for my sock and accessories patterns.

What you can expect from my patterns:
My patterns are well written and easy to follow, with clear instructions and charts. Patterns are tech edited and sometimes test knit to ensure accuracy. I also share tutorials and tips on my website and newsletter, to help you improve your knitting and crochet skills.

You can browse and buy my patterns from my Ravelry store or my website. You can also follow me on Instagram and Facebook to see my latest designs and updates. I love seeing your finished projects, so please tag me or use the hashtag #janeburnsdesigns to share your creations.

Thank you for visiting my page and supporting my work. I hope you enjoy knitting and crocheting with me. Happy crafting! :blush:

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to download your free pattern [here][1].


***You can buy my patterns from my Ravelry store***, [here][2]

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.

If you would like to become part of the [Jane Burns Designs community,][3] please join the group and say hello....


  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/jane-burns-designs
users.about_me_html:
Hi, I’m Jane, the designer behind Jane Burns Designs. I’m a knit and crochet pattern designer based in Lincoln, UK. I love creating whimsical and fun projects that are as enjoyable to make as they are to wear.

I have been designing knitting and crochet patterns for over 15 years, and I have worked with many UK knitting magazines, such as The Knitter, Simply Knitting, Knit Now, and Let’s Knit. Collaborated with some amazing yarn companies, Scheepjes, King Cole, and Eden Cottage Yarns to name a few.

I often say that two designers share a studio in my head, one loves whimsy, bright palettes and fun elements, most seen in my children’s designs. The other, likes to focus on the bringing some calm and self-care, utilising more muted tones for my sock and accessories patterns.

What you can expect from my patterns:
My patterns are well written and easy to follow, with clear instructions and charts. Patterns are tech edited and sometimes test knit to ensure accuracy. I also share tutorials and tips on my website and newsletter, to help you improve your knitting and crochet skills.

You can browse and buy my patterns from my Ravelry store or my website. You can also follow me on Instagram and Facebook to see my latest designs and updates. I love seeing your finished projects, so please tag me or use the hashtag #janeburnsdesigns to share your creations.

Thank you for visiting my page and supporting my work. I hope you enjoy knitting and crocheting with me. Happy crafting!

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to download your free pattern here.

You can buy my patterns from my Ravelry store, here

If you would like to become part of the Jane Burns Designs community, please join the group and say hello….
